description: The Term-DLM (Term Dynamic Load Management) and Auto-DLM programs are long-term, contract-based demand response programs procured by National Grid New York. Term-DLM is a day-ahead peak-shaving program requiring 21 hours or more advance notice, while Auto-DLM requires rapid 10-minute response capability. Both programs were established in September 2020 by the NY Public Service Commission to provide fixed pricing for 3-5 year contract terms, encouraging investment in battery storage and clean energy technologies. National Grid contracts directly with Curtailment Service Providers (CSPs) or individual customers for multi-year terms.

service_territories: National Grid electric service territory in Upstate New York
Location-specific Auto-DLM program (9.39 MW target for specific areas)

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Minimum capacity requirements apply. Individual customers can participate if meeting minimum kW threshold, or through aggregation via Curtailment Service Providers (CSPs). Both individual large C&I customers and aggregated portfolios of smaller customers are eligible.

Can participate directly or through Curtailment Service Provider (CSP)
Must commit to 3-5 year contract terms
Communicating interval meter required for measurement and verification
Seven approved CSPs available: Enel X, CPower, Voltus, Logical Buildings, GridRewards (EnergyHub), Budderfly, Ecotagious
Customers can participate in both National Grid utility programs and NYISO programs, though performance payments may be limited during overlapping events
Customers can participate in both Term-DLM/Auto-DLM and CSRP, but performance payments may be limited during overlapping events
Battery storage systems explicitly encouraged to participate - program designed to provide revenue certainty for energy storage investments

notification_details: Term-DLM events: 21 hours or more advance notice (day-ahead)
Auto-DLM events: Less than 21 hours advance notice, down to 10 minutes
Auto-DLM specifically designed for rapid-response resources like battery storage
Notification sent through CSP for aggregated customers
Direct customers receive notification from National Grid

seasonal_rates.notes: Reservation option incentives based upon bid acceptance but may exceed $20 per kW. Exact rates determined through competitive bidding process for 2025 and 2026 vintage years.

capacity_rate.notes: Capacity payments for reservation option determined through competitive RFP process. Public documentation indicates reservation payments may exceed $20/kW but exact rates are bid-based and vary by contract. For 2026 capability period, bid deadline is February 28, 2025.

performance_rate.notes: Performance payment of $0.10/kWh applies to load reduction option during all Term-DLM and Auto-DLM events. Reservation option holders also receive performance payments in addition to capacity payments.

penalty_structure.penalty_description: Contract-based penalties for non-performance likely included in individual CSP agreements and National Grid contracts. Specific penalty structures not disclosed in public documentation but typical for long-term capacity contracts.

bonus_payments.description: Auto-DLM program pays premium rates for rapid 10-minute response capability compared to standard Term-DLM 21-hour notice program

payment_details: Reservation option: Monthly capacity payments during capability period (May-September) plus performance payments during events
Load reduction option: Performance payments only ($0.10/kWh during events)
Multi-year contracts provide price certainty for 3-5 year terms
Payments made to CSPs who compensate enrolled customers per contract terms
Direct participants receive payments directly from National Grid
Contract terms and pricing determined through competitive bidding process

seasons.notes: Term-DLM and Auto-DLM events called during capability period Monday through Friday. Events not called on weekends or holidays (unlike DLRP which can be called any day). Specific event frequency depends on system conditions and forecasted peak demand.

call_windows.notes: Term-DLM events called Monday-Friday during capability period with 21+ hours notice. Specific call windows not publicly documented but aligned with NYISO day-ahead market.
Auto-DLM events can be called 7 days a week including holidays, with as little as 10 minutes notice for rapid response to system needs.

event_trigger_conditions: Term-DLM: Deployed when day-ahead forecasted peak load reaches 92% of forecast system peak demand for the season
Auto-DLM: Deployed for rapid response to system conditions in specific geographic areas
System-wide Term-DLM targets over 100 MW of load relief
Auto-DLM targets 9.39 MW of location-specific rapid load relief
event_parameters.notes: Auto-DLM requires 10-minute response time - explicitly designed for battery energy storage and other rapid-response DER. Term-DLM requires 21+ hour notice for day-ahead planning. Event frequency not publicly documented but tied to system peak conditions during May-September capability period.

nomination_bidding.bidding_structure: RFP-based competitive bidding for multi-year contracts

enrollment_period.notes: For 2026 capability period: Bids due February 28, 2025. For 2025 capability period: Bids were due March 1, 2024 with notifications by March 31, 2024 and participation starting May 1, 2025. Annual RFP process for each vintage year. Customers submit competitive bids for reservation payments through RFP process. Contracts awarded for 3-5 year terms to provide revenue certainty.

baseline_methodology.calculation_type: Rolling average methodology (specific details determined by contract)
verification_methods: M&V performed by National Grid or CSP
Baseline methodology specified in individual contracts
baseline_methodology.performance_calculation: Actual load reduction compared to baseline to verify contracted kW delivery. Performance metrics tracked for both capacity commitment and actual delivery.

Explicitly designed to encourage battery energy storage investment
Two-tier program structure: Term-DLM (day-ahead) and Auto-DLM (10-minute response)
Auto-DLM pays premium for rapid response capability - ideal for BESS
Competitive RFP bidding process for capacity contracts
Can stack with NYISO programs and National Grid CSRP (with limitations during overlapping events)

program_evolution.change_description: 2025 vintage year: Bids submitted by March 1, 2024, notifications by March 31, 2024, participation began May 1, 2025. Multi-year contracts continue from 2024 vintage year plus new 2025 contracts.
December 2023: National Grid announced load management solicitation for 2025 vintage year seeking over 100 MW Term-DLM and 9.39 MW Auto-DLM. RFP process managed through Piclo platform partnership.
April 2021: Con Edison and National Grid selected CPower and other aggregators for DLM program implementation following 2020 PSC order.

September 2020: NY Public Service Commission established Term-DLM and Auto-DLM programs through Case 14-E-0423. Programs designed to provide minimum 3-year contract terms to drive energy storage development and DER participation.

integration_metadata.notes: Program is ACTIVE and currently enrolling for 2026 capability period (deadline February 28, 2025). Moderate data quality - public documentation confirms program structure, payment options, and enrollment process, but detailed payment rates are confidential and determined through competitive bidding. Key strengths: Multi-year contracts (3-5 years) provide revenue certainty for battery storage investments; Auto-DLM program specifically designed for rapid 10-minute response (ideal for BESS); can stack with NYISO programs and CSRP. Payment structure: Reservation option may exceed $20/kW (bid-based) plus performance payments, or load reduction option at $0.10/kWh. Seven approved CSPs available for aggregation. Battery storage explicitly encouraged and eligible. Limited public data on historical event frequency and actual capacity rates. Suitable for BESS optimization with high value for Auto-DLM 10-minute response capability.

battery_storage_details.auto_dlm_bess_fit: Auto-DLM 10-minute response requirement is ideal for battery energy storage systems - BESS can respond faster than traditional load curtailment
battery_storage_details.stacking_opportunities: Can stack with NYISO wholesale market programs and CSRP utility program, though performance payments may be limited during overlapping events
battery_storage_details.long_term_contracts: 3-5 year contracts provide revenue predictability for battery project financing and ROI calculations
battery_storage_details.premium_pricing: Auto-DLM pays premium rates for rapid response capability that BESS can easily provide

additional_program_details.data_availability_notes: Limited public documentation on detailed program rules compared to tariff-based programs like CSRP and DLRP. Exact capacity payment rates are confidential and determined through competitive bidding. Public sources confirm program structure, payment options ($0.10/kWh performance, reservation >$20/kW), enrollment process, and 2026 RFP deadline (Feb 28, 2025). Historical event data not publicly available. Program confirmed active and enrolling. Battery storage eligibility explicitly confirmed and encouraged.
